Everything we launched at Config 2024
Get started
Contact us

WHAT’S NEW FROM CONFIG 2024

Discover new ways to level up your designs with AI , create dynamic presentations with Figma Slides , and handoff with extra clarity in Dev Mode .

Your creativity, unblocked with Figma AI
Minimize distractions. Expand your thinking.

Get started faster, find what you’re looking for, and stay in the flow. Make space for more creativity.

Figma AI features will be free in beta and rolled out gradually. After the beta period there may be an added cost.

Learn more
Search with a visual

Upload an image to instantly find an exact match or a similar design your teammates have created.

Learn more

Generate first drafts in seconds

Start with a prompt to produce different stylings and layouts for your design ideas. Tap First Draft to make it happen.

Learn more

Wire up a prototype instantly

Tap Make Prototype to instantly turn your static mocks into an interactive prototype.

Learn more

Rename layers automatically

With just a click, you can contextually rename and organize all your layers. And yes, your teammates will love you for it.

Learn more

Say hello to UI3, the redesigned Figma editor
Approachable, adaptable, amazingly agile

With a more approachable interface that’s been reorganized for ergonomics, you have more room to focus on your work.

This is in beta and will be rolled out gradually.

Learn more
A new view into Dev Mode, plus the launch of Code Connect
A workflow built for building

Now in Dev Mode, new Design Statuses like Edited and Completed make it easier to communicate what’s changed and ready—supporting a more fluid development process.

Try it out
Focus in on the details you need

Instantly see all designs marked Ready for Dev. Inspect a specific design in Focus View. Zero distractions so you can zero in.

Learn more

Your code, added to Dev Mode

Bring your component code into Dev Mode with Code Connect so developers get the right code, every time. Or, add code from a supported UI kit.

Learn more

Now presenting: Figma Slides
Create presentations like a pro

With advanced design capabilities, co-creation tools, and built-in features to engage your audience, it’s easier than ever to craft impressive slide decks.

Figma Slides is free in open beta. In early 2025, it will be available on free and paid plans, starting at $3 and $5 per user/month.

Try Slides
Your favorite Figma features just got better
More auto in your layouts

Add Auto Layout to full design elements with a single click. Plus, Auto Layout properties are now more responsive.

Learn more

Prototype for any screen size

View your designs on any screen size with a new prototype viewer experience that resizes responsively.

Learn more

Get started quickly with a UI kit

Jumpstart your design process with components from UI kits by Figma and our partners, Apple iOS and Google Material Design. Now available by default in Figma.

Learn more

Turn a new page in FigJam

Bring order to your files while keeping your jams in one place with pages in FigJam.

Learn more

Learn more about our latest releases
Manage unassigned drafts

OCT 15, 2024

Figma is making it easier for admins to find and manage draft folders of members and guests who have been removed from their organization, now known as "unassigned drafts."

UI3 in beta for all Figma users

OCT 10, 2024

Today, 100% of Figma users will have access to the redesigned Figma, called UI3, with the option to revert back to the previous design while UI3 is still in beta.

New updates announced on the Sept ‘24 Release Notes livestream

OCT 1, 2024

Newest updates announced for September

See all release notes

WHAT’S NEW FROM CONFIG 2024

Discover new ways to level up your designs with AI , create dynamic presentations with Figma Slides , and handoff with extra clarity in Dev Mode .
WHAT’S NEW FROM CONFIG 2024
Discover new ways to level up your designs with AI , create dynamic presentations with Figma Slides , and handoff with extra clarity in Dev Mode .

Your creativity, unblocked with Figma AI
Minimize distractions. Expand your thinking.

Get started faster, find what you’re looking for, and stay in the flow. Make space for more creativity.

Figma AI features will be free in beta and rolled out gradually. After the beta period there may be an added cost.

Create presentations like a pro

With advanced design capabilities, co-creation tools, and built-in features to engage your audience, it’s easier than ever to craft impressive slide decks.

Manage unassigned drafts

OCT 15, 2024

Figma is making it easier for admins to find and manage draft folders of members and guests who have been removed from their organization, now known as "unassigned drafts."

UI3 in beta for all Figma users

OCT 10, 2024

Today, 100% of Figma users will have access to the redesigned Figma, called UI3, with the option to revert back to the previous design while UI3 is still in beta.

New updates announced on the Sept ‘24 Release Notes livestream

Manage unassigned drafts

OCT 15, 2024

Figma is making it easier for admins to find and manage draft folders of members and guests who have been removed from their organization, now known as "unassigned drafts."

UI3 in beta for all Figma users

OCT 10, 2024

Today, 100% of Figma users will have access to the redesigned Figma, called UI3, with the option to revert back to the previous design while UI3 is still in beta.

New updates announced on the Sept ‘24 Release Notes livestream

OCT 1, 2024

Newest updates announced for September

Figma DesignDesign and prototype in one place

Manage unassigned drafts

OCT 15, 2024

Figma is making it easier for admins to find and manage draft folders of members and guests who have been removed from their organization, now known as "unassigned drafts."

UI3 in beta for all Figma users

OCT 10, 2024

Today, 100% of Figma users will have access to the redesigned Figma, called UI3, with the option to revert back to the previous design while UI3 is still in beta.

Newest updates announced for September

p.text: Design and prototype in one place

Stories about how products take shape—and shape our world
Design and prototype in one place
Discover new ways to level up your designs with AI , create dynamic presentations with Figma Slides , and handoff with extra clarity in Dev Mode .
Get started faster, find what you’re looking for, and stay in the flow. Make space for more creativity.
Figma AI features will be free in beta and rolled out gradually. After the beta period there may be an added cost.
Upload an image to instantly find an exact match or a similar design your teammates have created.
Start with a prompt to produce different stylings and layouts for your design ideas. Tap First Draft to make it happen.
Tap Make Prototype to instantly turn your static mocks into an interactive prototype.
With just a click, you can contextually rename and organize all your layers. And yes, your teammates will love you for it.
With a more approachable interface that’s been reorganized for ergonomics, you have more room to focus on your work.
This is in beta and will be rolled out gradually.
Now in Dev Mode, new Design Statuses like Edited and Completed make it easier to communicate what’s changed and ready—supporting a more fluid development process.
Instantly see all designs marked Ready for Dev. Inspect a specific design in Focus View. Zero distractions so you can zero in.
Bring your component code into Dev Mode with Code Connect so developers get the right code, every time. Or, add code from a supported UI kit.
With advanced design capabilities, co-creation tools, and built-in features to engage your audience, it’s easier than ever to craft impressive slide decks.
Figma Slides is free in open beta. In early 2025, it will be available on free and paid plans, starting at $3 and $5 per user/month.
Add Auto Layout to full design elements with a single click. Plus, Auto Layout properties are now more responsive.
View your designs on any screen size with a new prototype viewer experience that resizes responsively.
Jumpstart your design process with components from UI kits by Figma and our partners, Apple iOS and Google Material Design. Now available by default in Figma.
Bring order to your files while keeping your jams in one place with pages in FigJam.
Figma is making it easier for admins to find and manage draft folders of members and guests who have been removed from their organization, now known as "unassigned drafts."
Today, 100% of Figma users will have access to the redesigned Figma, called UI3, with the option to revert back to the previous design while UI3 is still in beta.
